summary.en: pH usually means the acidity/alkalinity level of a solution; “ph” can also be a spelling pattern pronounced /f/.
summary.zh: pH通常指溶液的酸碱度；“ph”也可指一种拼写形式，常读作/f/。

definition.en: a number that shows how acidic or basic (alkaline) a liquid or solution is, usually on a scale from 0 to 14
definition.zh: pH值；表示液体或溶液酸性或碱性（碱度）的数值，通常范围为0到14

examples.en: Pure water has a pH of about 7.
Lemon juice has a low pH, so it tastes sour.
examples.zh: 柠檬汁的pH值很低，所以尝起来很酸。

examples.en: The shampoo is pH-balanced for sensitive skin.
examples.zh: 这款洗发水做了pH平衡，适合敏感肌。

definition.en: (in spelling) the letters “ph” used together to represent the /f/ sound in many English words
definition.zh: （拼写中）字母组合“ph”，在许多英语单词里表示/f/音

examples.en: Many words with “ph” come from Greek, like “photo” and “philosophy.”
examples.zh: 很多带“ph”的词来自希腊语，比如“photo”和“philosophy”。

extraExplanation: 在化学里，pH常被解释为溶液中氢离子浓度的“酸碱度指标”：pH < 7 通常表示酸性，pH = 7 中性，pH > 7 碱性。日常生活中常见于泳池水质、土壤检测、护肤品/洗发水“pH平衡”等场景。
拼写里的“ph”常与希腊语来源有关：古希腊语里有一个类似“送气的p”音（φ），进入拉丁语和英语后多演变为/f/，所以“ph”在英语里常读作/f/。
